title: Python Stock Market Analysis Dashboard
text:
This project is a Python-based stock market analysis and visualization dashboard designed to explore price trends, moving averages, and market behavior across different time periods.
The dashboard focuses on providing interactive insights into stock performance, making it easier to analyze trends and patterns commonly used in technical analysis.

title: Python Stock Market Analysis Dashboard

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: For this assessment, I used ChatGPT as the main GenAI tool. I chose this tool because it is effective for explaining technical concepts clearly, providing structured guidance, and assisting with problem-solving in a step-by-step manner.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: For this assessment, I used ChatGPT as the main GenAI tool. I chose this tool because it is effective for explaining technical concepts clearly, providing structured guidance, and assisting with problem-solving in a step-by-step manner.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: How GenAI helped me complete the assessment
text:
How GenAI helped me complete the assessment
ChatGPT helped me understand how to build and structure a Quarto website using RStudio.
For example, it guided me in: - Creating and organizing .qmd files - Configuring the _quarto.yml file for website navigation - Debugging issues such as broken navigation links and missing rendered pages - Creating a valid data visualization using R and ggplot2
These examples helped me complete the tasks more efficiently while still requiring me to implement and verify the solutions myself.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Benefits of using GenAI
One major benefit of using GenAI is efficiency. It reduces the time needed to search for documentation and provides direct, relevant explanations.
Another benefit is clarity, as complex concepts such as Quarto rendering and website structure were broken down into manageable steps.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Challenges of using GenAI
A challenge of using GenAI is that its suggestions still need to be verified. In some cases, minor mistakes such as incorrect file names or missing rendering steps can occur if the user follows suggestions blindly. This reinforced the importance of understanding the tools rather than relying entirely on AI-generated responses.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Future use of GenAI
In the future, I believe GenAI tools will assist me in my studies and work by helping with debugging, learning new technologies, and drafting technical documentation. However, I will continue to treat GenAI as a support tool rather than a replacement for critical thinking.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Additional thoughts
Overall, using GenAI in this assessment enhanced my learning experience by providing guidance while still requiring active engagement. When used responsibly, GenAI can be a valuable learning companion.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Story behind the visualization
I selected these visualizations to analyze both volatility and trend behavior in stock prices.
The daily returns plot makes it easier to identify periods of market instability that are not immediately visible from price charts alone.
The upward and downward run visualization complements this by showing how price movements cluster into trends, which is useful for understanding momentum and potential trading signals.
Together, these visualizations provide a more complete picture of stock market behavior than a single chart alone.

title: Data Visualization
text:
What was visualized

Daily returns â€“ numerical values representing day-to-day percentage price changes
Stock closing prices â€“ numerical time-series data
Run lengths â€“ counts of consecutive upward or downward price movements
Volatility patterns derived from return fluctuations

All visualizations are based on quantitative financial data.

title: Python Stock Market Analysis Dashboard
section: Technical analysis: Close price vs SMA
text:
Technical analysis: Close price vs SMA





This visualization compares the stockâ€™s closing price against its Simple Moving Average (SMA).
The SMA helps smooth short-term price fluctuations and provides a clearer view of overall trend direction.

title: Python Stock Market Analysis Dashboard
text:
Time period comparison





Users can switch between different time windows to observe how trends change across short-term and long-term horizons.

title: Python Stock Market Analysis Dashboard
text:

Python
Pandas & NumPy
Plotly / Matplotlib
Streamlit (for interactive dashboard)
Financial data APIs (e.g.Â Yahoo Finance)

title: Data Visualization
text:
Daily returns analysis





This visualization shows the daily percentage returns of a selected stock over time.
Large positive and negative spikes indicate periods of high volatility, while smaller fluctuations represent more stable trading days.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Upward and downward price runs





This visualization highlights consecutive upward and downward price movements in the stock price.
It summarizes the number of upward and downward runs, as well as the longest continuous trends, providing insight into market momentum.
